speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The Transcript Helper tab is your preparation station. This is where you can record, import, edit, and transcribe the audio needed for high-quality voice cloning.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: You can load an existing audio file using the 'Open' button, or you can record a new one directly in the app using the 'Record' button.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Once audio is loaded, its waveform will appear. You can left-click on the waveform to set a start point, and right-click to set an end point. The 'Crop' button will then trim the audio to your selection.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The 'Audio to Text' button is a powerful feature. It uses the integrated Whisper A I to listen to your loaded audio and automatically generate a transcript for it.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: This is the ideal workflow for preparing a voice clone: load your reference audio, click 'Audio to Text' to get an accurate transcript, and then 'Send All to Voice Clone Tab'.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: You can also save your work as a reusable Profile. This bundles the audio and transcript together, which you can load into the Voice Clone tab at any time.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Now for our final lessons: a closer look at the pro-level settings. Please load chapter fourteen.
